pyavia.aero¶

Contents¶

An Atmosphere class giving a fixed representation of atmospheric conditions.

Compressible, imperfect gas using polynomials from Walsh & Fletcher §3.

Members¶

pyavia.aero provides functions relating to aerodynamics, thermodynamics and fluid dynamics in general.

class pyavia.aero.Atmosphere(**kwargs)¶

Bases: object

An Atmosphere class giving a fixed representation of atmospheric conditions. Once constructed, all of the regular assosicated atmospheric properties are then made available through class properties.

Example

Set default result units as US or SI. Individual defaults can be set for each unit type:

>>> pa.aero.Atmosphere.set_default_style('SI')
>>> pa.aero.Atmosphere.unitdef_press = 'psi'

Show some ISA SSL values:

>>> atm = pa.aero.Atmosphere(H='SSL')
>>> print(f"P = {atm.pressure:.3f}, T = {atm.temperature:.2f}")
P = 14.696 psi, T = 288.15 K

Show density for an ISA standard altitude (note that these are formally geopotential altitudes):

>>> atm = pa.aero.Atmosphere(H=Dim(10000, 'ft'))
>>> print(f"ρ = {atm.ρ:.3f}")
ρ = 0.905 kg/m³

Show the temperature ratio for a pressure altitude with a temperature offset:

>>> atm = pa.aero.Atmosphere(H_press=Dim(34000,'ft'),
... T_offset=Dim(+15,'Δ°C'))
>>> print(f"Theta = {atm.theta:.3f}")
Theta = 0.818

Show the density ratio for an arbitrary non-standard atmosphere based on temperature / pressure:

>>> atm = pa.aero.Atmosphere(P=Dim(90, 'kPa'), T=Dim(-15, '°C'))
>>> print(f"σ = {atm.σ:.3f}")
σ = 0.991
property P¶
R = Dim(287.05287, 'J/K/kg')¶
property T¶
__init__(**kwargs)¶

Construct an atmosphere using a variety of possible methods, depending on the arguments provided.

Parameters

kwargs –

The following keyword combinations can be used. In each case the associated value must be a Dim object, e.g. H = Dim(5000, 'ft'):

  • H:

    • If H == ‘SSL’: Construct an ISA standard sea level atmosphere..

    • If ‘H’ is a Dim object: Construct an ISA standard atmosphere corresponding to a given geopotential altitude. This is generally what is used in most texts (assumes gravity fixed across altitudes). Note the uppercase H.

  • h_geometric: ISA standard atmosphere corresponding to a given geometric altitude.

  • T, P: Arbitrary atmosphere with given temperature and pressure.

  • H_press, T: Arbitrary atmosphere based on pressure altitude (altimeter set to 1013 mb / 29.92 in-Hg) and a given temperature.

  • H_press, T_offset: Same as H_press, T except temperature is given as an offset from the ISA standard value at that pressure altitude.

property a¶

\(a = \sqrt{\gamma RT}\).

property delta¶

\(δ = P / P_{SSL}\).

property density¶
property density_altitude¶

After finding the correct altitude range, density altitude is computed using a root bisection method, as it is non-linear.

property dynamic_viscosity¶

Dynamic viscosity (μ) also just called ‘viscosity’. It is computed using the empirical Sutherland equation shown in ISO 2533-1975 Eqn 22. It is invalid for very high or low temperatures and conditions at altitudes above 90 km.

property gamma¶

\(\gamma = c_p/c_v\) ratio of specific heats. This is presently set to a constant \(γ = 1.4\) which is valid for all ambient atmospheres which are relatively cold.

property kinematic_viscosity¶

Kinematic viscosity \(ν = μ/ρ\).

property pressure¶
property pressure_altitude¶
classmethod set_default_style(style: str = 'US')¶

Setting to give default results in style=’US’ or ‘SI’ units.

property sigma¶

\(\sigma = \rho/\rho_{SSL}\).

property speed_of_sound¶

\(a = \sqrt{\gamma RT}\).

property temperature¶
property theta¶

\(\theta = T/T_{SSL}\).

unitdef_alt = 'ft'¶
unitdef_dens = 'slug/ft^3'¶
unitdef_kine = 'ft²/s'¶
unitdef_press = 'psf'¶
unitdef_spd = 'ft/s'¶
unitdef_temp = '°R'¶
unitdef_visc = 'psf.s'¶
property γ¶

\(\gamma = c_p/c_v\) ratio of specific heats. This is presently set to a constant \(γ = 1.4\) which is valid for all ambient atmospheres which are relatively cold.

property δ¶

\(δ = P / P_{SSL}\).

property θ¶

\(\theta = T/T_{SSL}\).

property μ¶

Dynamic viscosity (μ) also just called ‘viscosity’. It is computed using the empirical Sutherland equation shown in ISO 2533-1975 Eqn 22. It is invalid for very high or low temperatures and conditions at altitudes above 90 km.

property ν¶

Kinematic viscosity \(ν = μ/ρ\).

property ρ¶
property σ¶

\(\sigma = \rho/\rho_{SSL}\).

class pyavia.aero.GasFlow(*, R, w=None, gas: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract base class representing common properties of gases flowing in 1-D. Once any gas is initialised, properties are fixed.

Note

This base class does not provide properties such as T0/T or P0/T because non-linearities in imperfect gas models may make these ratios moot. Refer to the specific derived class.

abstract property M¶

Mach number \(M = u/a\).

abstract property P¶

Stream / ambient pressure.

abstract property P0¶

Total / stagnation pressure.

property Q¶

Enthalpy flowrate Q = h * w. Units determined by multiplication.

property R¶

Gas constant R for the specific gas. R_specific = R_universal / M where R = 8.314462618 kg.m².s⁻².K⁻¹.mol⁻¹ and M is molar mass [kg/mol].

abstract property T¶

Stream / ambient temperature.

abstract property T0¶

Total / stagnation temperature.

__abstractmethods__ = frozenset({'M', 'P', 'P0', 'T', 'T0', 'cp', 'gamma', 'h', 's', 'special_args', 'u'})¶
__format__(format_spec) → str¶

Formatted output string. The defining state properties are assumed to be T, P, M, w by default. Format is applied to numeric values only.

__init__(*, R, w=None, gas: Optional[str] = None)¶

Construct an abstract base representation of flowing compressible gas. Once constructed, the properties of the gas are fixed.

Parameters

  • R – Gas constant for this particular gas (i.e. \(R = R_{univ}/n\)).

  • w – Mass flowrate

__repr__()¶

Return repr(self).

__str__()¶

Return str(self).

property a¶

Local speed of sound a = (γRT)**0.5.

abstract property cp¶

Specific heat capacity at constant pressure of the gas.

property cv¶

Specific heat capacity at constant volume of the gas.

abstract property gamma¶

Ratio of specific heats \(\gamma = c_p/c_v.\)

property gas¶

Identifier for the gas.

abstract property h¶

Specific enthalpy of the gas.

Note

The baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

property h0¶

Total / stagnation enthalpy of the gas, assuming it is brought to rest with losses or heat transfer computed as \(h_0 = h + \frac{1}{2}u^2\). Like all enthalpy values the baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

new_props(**kwargs) → pyavia.aero._gasflow.GasFlow¶

Return a new GasFlow object specialised to match self except without any state properties T, T0, P, P0, h, h0, s or M, which are to be supplied by the user in **kwargs. This is used for making a new GasFlow object from the current one but with changed properties.

Note

  • Any arguments in **kwargs supersedes any matching defaults supplied by new_props.

  • Mass flowrate w is also copied automatically.

  • Refer to __init__ for the derived class for valid property combinations.

property rho¶

Density ρ = P/(R.T).

abstract property s¶

Specific entropy of the gas.

Note

The baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

abstract classmethod special_args() → Sequence[str]¶

Return a sequence of strings listing any additional arguments specific to the derived class needed to fully fully initialise this object. Standard state properties T, T0, P, P0, h, h0, s or M and mass flowrate w are not to be included. Used by __repr__, __str__, __format__, new_props().

abstract property u¶

Flow velocity.

property w¶

Mass flowrate.

class pyavia.aero.GasFlowWF(*, P: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, P0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, s: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, M: Optional[float] = None, w: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, gas: str = 'air', FAR: float = 0.0)¶

Bases: pyavia.aero._gasflow.GasFlow

Compressible, imperfect gas using polynomials from Walsh & Fletcher §3. Includes optional products of combustion. Properties are fixed once initialised.

Note

  • Temperature range is 200 K → 2000 K.

  • Fuel-Air Ratio FAR = 0.00 → 0.05

  • Non-linear \(\gamma\), \(c_p\), h, s dependent on temperature (i.e. calorically imperfect). Stagnation enthalpy, temperature and pressure also do not assume a perfect gas. Stagnation properties are computed by bringing the flow to rest isentropically.

  • Internal values stored as SI [K, kPa, …].

  • Stream / static temperature and pressure and Mach number are the internal reference states.

property FAR¶

Fuel-Air Ratio \(FAR = w_f / w_{total}\) where \(w_f\) is the massflow of fuel products of combustion and \(w_{total}\) is the total massflow. E.G. If the upstream flow was pure airflow of \(w_{air}\) then \(FAR = w_f / (w_f + w_{air})\).

property M¶

Mach number \(M = u/a\).

property P¶

Stream / ambient pressure.

property P0¶

Total / stagnation pressure.

property T¶

Stream / ambient temperature.

property T0¶

Total / stagnation temperature.

__abstractmethods__ = frozenset({})¶
__init__(*, P: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, P0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, s: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, M: Optional[float] = None, w: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, gas: str = 'air', FAR: float = 0.0)¶

Construct a compressible, imperfect gas, based on interpolating polynomials given in Walsh & Fletcher, “Gas Turbine Performance”, Second Edition, Chapter 3.

Note

  • Three state property arguments (T, h, T0, h0, s, P, P0, M) are required, but can be supplied in any combination that properly defines the gas.

  • If P and T are supplied these are directly set and initialisation is complete. All other combinations result in an iterative convergence using the values of T [K], P [kPa] and M.

  • Non-zero FAR normally accompanies gases including products of combustion but this is not enforced. This is because this combinatinon may be useful in some hypothetical or debugging scenarios.

Parameters

  • P (Dim, optional) – Stream / static pressure.

  • P0 (Dim, optional) – Total / stagnation pressure (also P0).

  • T (Dim, optional) – Stream / static temperature.

  • T0 (Dim, optional) – Total /stagnation temperature (also T0).

  • h (Dim, optional) – Specific enthalpy.

  • h0 (Dim, optional) – Total / stagnation enthalpy.

  • s (Dim, optional) – Specific entropy.

  • M (float, optional) – Mach number.

  • w (Dim, optional) – Mass flowrate. Default = None.

  • gas (str, optional) –

    Gas identifier. Default = ‘air’. Available gas values are:

    • ’air’: Dry air

    • ’burned_kerosene’: Products of combustion for kerosene in dry air.

    • ’burned_diesel’: Products of combustion for diesel in dry air.

  • FAR (float, optional) – Fuel-Air Ratio. Default = 0.0.

Raises

GasError – On invalid arguments.

property cp¶

Specific heat capacity at constant pressure of the gas.

property gamma¶

Ratio of specific heats \(\gamma = c_p/c_v.\)

property h¶

Specific enthalpy of the gas.

Note

The baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

property s¶

Specific entropy of the gas.

Note

The baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

classmethod special_args()¶

Return a sequence of strings listing any additional arguments specific to the derived class needed to fully fully initialise this object. Standard state properties T, T0, P, P0, h, h0, s or M and mass flowrate w are not to be included. Used by __repr__, __str__, __format__, new_props().

property u¶

Flow velocity.

class pyavia.aero.PerfectGasFlow(*, P: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, P0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, s: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, M: Optional[float] = None, w: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, gas: str = 'air', gamma: float = 1.4)¶

Bases: pyavia.aero._gasflow.GasFlow

A simplified compressible gas, thermally and calorically perfect. I.E. cp and R are constant. Once initialised, properties are fixed.

Note

  • Internally, stream pressure, temperature, Mach number and ratio of specific heats are the stored flow properties (P, T, M, γ).

  • Sepcific enthalpy computation is \(h = h_0 + c_p.(T - T_{ref})\).

  • Specific entropy computation is \(s = s_0 + c_p.ln(T / T_{ref}) - R.ln(P / P_{ref})\).

property M¶

Mach number \(M = u/a\).

property P¶

Stream / ambient pressure.

property P0¶

Total / stagnation pressure.

property P0_on_P¶

Ratio of total (stagnation) pressure to static pressure computed using \(\frac{P_0}{P} = (1 + \frac{1}{2}(γ - 1)M^2)^{\frac{γ}{γ - 1}}\), which assumes a perfect gas.

property T¶

Stream / ambient temperature.

property T0¶

Total / stagnation temperature.

property T0_on_T¶

Ratio of total (stagnation) pressure to static temperature computed using \(\frac{T_0}{T} = 1 + \frac{1}{2}(γ - 1)M^2\), which assumes a perfect gas.

__abstractmethods__ = frozenset({})¶
__init__(*, P: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, P0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, T0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, h0: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, s: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, M: Optional[float] = None, w: Optional[pyavia.core.units.Dim] = None, gas: str = 'air', gamma: float = 1.4)¶

Construct a thermally and calorically perfect, compressible gas flowing in 1-D. Three state property arguments must be given that completely specify the gas state.

Parameters

  • P0 (Dim, optional) – Total / stagnation pressure.

  • T0 (Dim, optional) – Total / stagnation temperature.

  • P (Dim, optional) – Stream / static pressure.

  • T (Dim, optional) – Stream / static temperature.

  • h (Dim, optional) – Specific enthalpy.

  • h0 (Dim, optional) – Total / stagnation enthalpy.

  • s (Dim, optional) – Specific entropy.

  • M (float, optional) – Mach number.

  • w (Dim, optional) – Mass flowrate. Default = None.

  • gas (str, optional) –

    Gas idenfitifer. Supported values are:

    • ’air’.

  • gamma (float, optional) –

    Ratio of specific heats. Commonly used values for air are:

    • γ = 1.4: Atmospheric air, compressors (default).

    • γ = 1.33: Hot air, burners, turbines.

property cp¶

Specific heat capacity at constant pressure of the gas.

property gamma¶

Ratio of specific heats \(\gamma = c_p/c_v.\)

property h¶

Specific enthalpy of the gas.

Note

The baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

property s¶

Specific entropy of the gas.

Note

The baseline is arbitrary and values from different formulations / classes should not be compared.

property u¶

Flow velocity.
